pageContext.claim: “One of the things that happens is when you don't make a deal upfront, then the doctor, or whoever it may it be, all of a sudden doubles and triples the price, because they figure you don’t care or you're rich -- you have plenty of money; you don't have to worry about it.”
pageContext.analysis: It's unclear what Trump is talking about. Most people have private insurance, and the rates are under contract through the insurance provider. There's no negotiation like a real estate deal or buying a car. The doctor may have set rates, but the charges will often be lower because of the negotiations he or she had previously had with the insurance company.
